info.title: Akamai: Edge DNS Zone Management API

post.description: Creates a new Change List based on the most recent version of a zone. No POST body is needed, since the object is read-only.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS Zone Management API

schema.description: Metadata about a change list. Includes the zone version that the change list was derived from when it was created.

changeTag.description: An ETag for this change list.

lastModifiedDate.description: An ISO 8601 date indicating the last time the change list was modified.

stale.description: If the parent version is not current, this change list is stale.

zoneVersionId.description: The zone version identifier for the parent version of this change list.

Location.description: Provides a URL path you can GET the newly created resource from.

parameters.description: The name of an Edge DNS zone.
parameters.name: zone

parameters.description: __Enum__ You can't create a change list if you've already created one for this zone. The default `none` raises an error if a change list exists. Use `any` to delete any existing change lists before running the create operation. Use `stale` to automatically delete stale change lists before running the create operation. The `stale` option raises an error if there's a change list attached to the current version.
parameters.name: overwrite

get.description: Show [differences](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-dns/reference/get-zone-versions-diff) between this change list and its base version.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS Zone Management API

schema.description: A report on the difference between two zone versions or a version and a change list.

diffs.description: Collections of differences between the two versions.

recordSetDiffs.description: A collection of record sets that have changed between two versions.

items.description: The difference in a record set between two versions.

fromValue.description: The prior value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value will not exist on an `ADD` difference.

name.description: The name of the record set that changed.

operation.description: The type of difference. An `ADD` difference will contain the `toValue` but not a `fromValue`. A `DELETE` difference is the other way around. An `EDIT` difference will have both fields.

toValue.description: The new value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value will not exist on an `DELETE` difference.

type.description: The type of the record set that changed.

settingsDiffs.description: A collection of settings fields that have changed between two versions.

items.description: The difference in a settings value between two versions.

fieldName.description: The name of the settings value that changed.

fromValue.description: The prior value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value is not present for an `ADD` difference.

operation.description: The type of difference. An `ADD` difference contains the `toValue` and a `DELETE` difference contains a `fromValue`. An `EDIT` difference contains both fields.

toValue.description: The new value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value is not present for a `DELETE` difference.

metadata.description: Metadata about this diff report, describing the versions being diffed.

fromVersionId.description: The version ID of the base version.

fromVersionLastModifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the base version was last modified.

toVersionId.description: The version ID of the new version or change list.

toVersionLastModifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the new change list version was last modified.

state.description: The state of this record in the change list. A `PRISTINE` record has not been changed, otherwise it has been `ADDED`, `EDITED`, or `DELETED`.

ttl.description: The number of seconds that this record should live in a resolver's cache before being refetched. Not used When the `op` value for the PATCH request is DELETE.

get.description: Retrieves the zone's settings based on the selected change list. Zone settings include metadata about the zone, but not the record sets. The data returned reflects the zone setting changes included in the change list. This call works even if the change list is stale.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS Zone Management API

schema.description: An Edge DNS zone. This object contains zone settings, but not record sets.

activationState.description: The current status of zone activation.

aliasCount.description: For `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only. The number of zones of type `ALIAS` that point to this zone.

endCustomerId.description: Free-form user identifier for this zone, often used by resellers.

lastActivationDate.description: For `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only. An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the latest version was activated.

lastModifiedBy.description: The name of the user that last edited this zone.

lastModifiedDate.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the zone was last modified.

masters.description: For `SECONDARY` zones only. The names or addresses of the customer's nameservers from which the zone data should be retrieved.

signAndServe.description: Whether DNSSEC Sign&Serve is enabled. Applies to `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only.

signAndServeAlgorithm.description: The algorithm currently or last used for DNSSEC Sign&Serve. Absent if no algorithm has ever been assigned to this zone.

subzoneGrants.description: Determines if cross-account subzones are enabled. This does not impact the ability to create subzones that you are presently authorized to edit.

target.description: For `ALIAS` zones only. The name of the zone whose configuration this zone copies.

tsigKey.description: For `SECONDARY` zones only. The TSIG key used for zone transfers.

zonesCount.description: The number of zones that reference this key.

type.description: The zone type. A `PRIMARY` zone's records are stored in the Akamai Portal. A `SECONDARY` zone's records are stored on the customer's nameservers. `ALIAS` zones allow users to duplicate the configuration of an existing zone.

versionId.description: The UUID of the most recently activated version. You can use this value as an `ETag` when performing operations that affect zones.

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). post.description: Submits a request to delete one or more new Zones asynchronously. The request body contains a JSON array. Each element in the array is the name of a zone to be deleted.  Before deleting a zone from the Edge DNS system, the API makes sure Akamai servers aren't receiving DNS requests for that zone. It also checks that the zone is not currently delegated to Akamai's nameservers.  An offline task deletes the new zones. The result of this operation is a `requestId`, that you can use to check the task's status and view its results once it completes.

post.description: Returns the results of the most recent zone transfer attempts for one or more zones.  When you configure a `SECONDARY` zone, several Akamai nameservers known as zone transfer agents perform zone transfer requests to fetch the record data from the zone's configured master nameservers. The data returned by this operation describes the results of those zone transfers.

get.description: Shows the settings for current and prior versions of this Zone, in reverse chronological order of modification. Many versions in this list may look very similar because a new version is created every time the zone's settings or record sets are changed. This operation is [paginated](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-dns/reference/use-pagination).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS Zone Management API

versions.description: A list of Edge DNS zones. Each object contains zone settings, but not record sets.

items.description: An Edge DNS zone. This object contains zone settings, but not record sets.

activationState.description: The current status of zone activation.

aliasCount.description: For `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only. The number of zones of type `ALIAS` that point to this zone.

endCustomerId.description: Free-form user identifier for this zone, often used by resellers.

lastActivationDate.description: For `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only. An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the latest version was activated.

lastModifiedBy.description: The name of the user that last edited this zone.

lastModifiedDate.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the zone was last modified.

masters.description: For `SECONDARY` zones only. The names or addresses of the customer's nameservers from which the zone data should be retrieved.

signAndServe.description: Whether DNSSEC Sign&Serve is enabled. Applies to `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only.

signAndServeAlgorithm.description: The algorithm currently or last used for DNSSEC Sign&Serve. Absent if no algorithm has ever been assigned to this zone.

subzoneGrants.description: Determines if cross-account subzones are enabled. This does not impact the ability to create subzones that you are presently authorized to edit.

target.description: For `ALIAS` zones only. The name of the zone whose configuration this zone copies.

tsigKey.description: For `SECONDARY` zones only. The TSIG key used for zone transfers.

zonesCount.description: The number of zones that reference this key.

type.description: The zone type. A `PRIMARY` zone's records are stored in the Akamai Portal. A `SECONDARY` zone's records are stored on the customer's nameservers. `ALIAS` zones allow users to duplicate the configuration of an existing zone.

versionId.description: The UUID of the most recently activated version. You can use this value as an `ETag` when performing operations that affect zones.

get.description: Displays the [difference](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-dns/reference/get-zone-versions-diff) between any two versions of a zone, as specified in the query parameters.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS Zone Management API

schema.description: A report on the difference between two zone versions or a version and a change list.

diffs.description: Collections of differences between the two versions.

recordSetDiffs.description: A collection of record sets that have changed between two versions.

items.description: The difference in a record set between two versions.

fromValue.description: The prior value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value will not exist on an `ADD` difference.

name.description: The name of the record set that changed.

operation.description: The type of difference. An `ADD` difference will contain the `toValue` but not a `fromValue`. A `DELETE` difference is the other way around. An `EDIT` difference will have both fields.

toValue.description: The new value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value will not exist on an `DELETE` difference.

type.description: The type of the record set that changed.

settingsDiffs.description: A collection of settings fields that have changed between two versions.

items.description: The difference in a settings value between two versions.

fieldName.description: The name of the settings value that changed.

fromValue.description: The prior value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value is not present for an `ADD` difference.

operation.description: The type of difference. An `ADD` difference contains the `toValue` and a `DELETE` difference contains a `fromValue`. An `EDIT` difference contains both fields.

toValue.description: The new value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value is not present for a `DELETE` difference.

metadata.description: Metadata about this diff report, describing the versions being diffed.

fromVersionId.description: The version ID of the base version.

fromVersionLastModifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the base version was last modified.

toVersionId.description: The version ID of the new version or change list.

toVersionLastModifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the new change list version was last modified.

parameters.description: UUID for "base" version.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: UUID of version to diff against base version.

text/dns.example: example.com.        10000    IN SOA ns1.akamaidns.com. webmaster.example.com. 1 28800 14400 2419200 86400 example.com.        10000    IN NS  ns1.akamaidns.com. example.com.        10000    IN NS  ns2.akamaidns.com. example.com.            300 IN  A   10.0.0.1 example.com.            300 IN  A   10.0.0.2 www.example.com.        300 IN  A   10.0.0.1 www.example.com.        300 IN  A   10.0.0.2

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

parameters.description: A UUID indicating a zone version tag.
parameters.name: uuid

parameters.description: The name of the zone.
parameters.name: zone

post.description: Upload new record set data for this zone in master zone file format. Replaces any existing record sets. This operation applies to primary zones and secondary zones. See [RFC 1035](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1035) section 5 and [RFC 1034](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1034) section 3.6.1 for more information.  Zone files can contain only US-ASCII characters 0–127. Where allowed, you can encode high-order ASCII characters, 128+, with a backslash plus a three-digit decimal number representing the byte value. For example, `\233` instead of `é`.  `AKAMAICDN` and `AKAMAITLC` records can't be represented in this format. Uploading a zone file does not affect these records.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS Zone Management API

text/dns.example: example.com.        10000    IN SOA ns1.akamaidns.com. webmaster.example.com. 1 28800 14400 2419200 86400 example.com.        10000    IN NS  ns1.akamaidns.com. example.com.        10000    IN NS  ns2.akamaidns.com. example.com.            300 IN  A   10.0.0.1 example.com.            300 IN  A   10.0.0.2 www.example.com.        300 IN  A   10.0.0.1 www.example.com.        300 IN  A   10.0.0.2

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

get.description: Download this zone's record set data in master zone file format. This operation applies to primary zones and secondary zones. See [RFC 1035](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1035) section 5 and [RFC 1034](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1034) section 3.6.1 for more information.  `AKAMAICDN` and `AKAMAITLC` records can't be represented in this format, so they are displayed as comment lines.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS Zone Management API

text/dns.example: example.com.        10000    IN SOA ns1.akamaidns.com. webmaster.example.com. 1 28800 14400 2419200 86400 example.com.        10000    IN NS  ns1.akamaidns.com. example.com.        10000    IN NS  ns2.akamaidns.com. example.com.            300 IN  A   10.0.0.1 example.com.            300 IN  A   10.0.0.2 www.example.com.        300 IN  A   10.0.0.1 www.example.com.        300 IN  A   10.0.0.2

The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
